title: Performance Evaluation Design and Implementation for Engineering Project-Based Programs

context.prior_knowledge: Basic knowledge of engineering project management and evaluation, understanding of the ADDIE model, and familiarity with program outcomes (PO) concepts
context.additional_context: Microlearning optimized for mobile environments, teaching practitioners how to design and implement a program performance evaluation system for engineering projects based on the ADDIE model.

learning_goals: Participants can design an engineering project evaluation process by applying the ADDIE modelâ€™s five phases (Analysis, Design, Development, Implementation, Evaluation).
Participants can develop specific assessment rubrics using Project-Outcome (PO) mapping guidelines.
Participants can evaluate individual achievement levels by collecting and analyzing performance data at each project stage in a mobile-based microlearning environment.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
